title: SRM at 30: Lessons from Early Data-Centric Networking and Their Impact on Named Data Networking
summary: A 1995 SIGCOMM paper, "A Reliable Multicast Framework for Light-weight Sessions and Application-Level Framing", commonly known as SRM, explored a fundamentally new approach to reliable multiparty data delivery. Rather than adapting established sender-driven reliable unicast mechanisms to multicast, as most contemporaneous proposals did, SRM introduced a data-centric model in which data receivers recover losses by explicitly requesting missing data.
